About Me

Let me tell you a few things about myself

BIO

My Name is Luka Necajev. I enjoy learning about computer programs and have taken an interest in computer networks and network security. I am currently studying in Sheridan College, completing the Computer Software and Network Engeneering Advanced Diploma. In my spare time I try to keep myself busy by continuing to learning about other programming languages and reading about networks and how to set them up. I may usually not the smartest person in the room, but I am always the hardest working because of it.

Web Development & Databases

HTML-5,CSS,SCSS,JAVA-SCRIPT,SQL,PHP

I ended up playing around with web developming languages for fun as a hobby when I was younger. It was how I started programming and is what I do when I am bored. Although these languages are not very hard to learn, it was interesting to make something proffessional looking, including my portfolio and a few variations of a news website....

User Interfaces

I have alot of fun designing and developing the user interface for macheines and for software applications. My favourate thing that I designed was the updated UI of the outdated internal website of Sheridan(Access Sheridan), scholastics website was a close second, it was difficult to try to keep the current theme of the website and fix the errors in the website.

Networks

Cisco Routing

In school I had a course about networks, I learned the basics from this course, and I realized that I really enjoyed learning about networks and the Iot. Since that course I have been reading up and broadening my knowledge by reading books like "CCNA Cisco Certified Network Associate Study Guide, 7th Edition" and "Data Communications and Networking" I am currently working towards getting my CCNA Certificate for routing and switching.
